review: We ate here yesterday during the grand opening. I expected to encounter a few snags and we certainly did. In the spirit of fairness, I will return in a few months to see how they're doing. In the meantime I recommend you to wait a while for them to get it together, and then give them a chance.      After placing our order, we waited a full 15 minutes until everything arrived simultaneously; the drinks, the appetizers, the kid's meal, and the entrees. This was annoying, of course. Had they been open for a longer time, I would have been much more angry about this. But as it is, they're still finding their rhythm.           The food itself was pretty good but nothing special. The menu is comparable to a more modernised Chili's but with slightly less Tex Mex influence. They have bottomless fries with every burger, which is nice, and a wide variety of dipping sauces as well as a jar of seasoned salt on the table.       The fried zucchini appetizer was far too thick; each stick was about an inch and a half wide, cold, and not crispy at all. The onion rings, on the other hand, were so overbreaded and crispy that the forgotten onion inside would slide right out when bitten.        Their burgers have the usual interesting toppings that you'd expect to see, which are fun. But the patty itself is a little on the dry and bland side. The burgers were definitely average and did not win me over, which does not bode well for a place that specializes in burgers.      I just feel like Red Robin can't compete with the superior burger joints in this area. (see my reviews of "25 Burgers" and "Five Guys"). If they do succeed, it will be because they are in the mall and can attract guests with the sheer convenience of their location.         This location does have beer available (and possibly liquor, I'm not certain) and an interesting sounding Guiness Milkshake. When I come back I will definitely see what that's all about. And burgers are not the only thing they serve; look at their menu and you may see something that excites you.

A good experience over all. We had to wait about five-ten minutes for a table, but that was about it.  We personally knew our server so she took extra good care of us, so I can't say anything bad about the service at all! The food was great. I had the Guac/Bacon burger, cooked with no pink, on a whole wheat bun. The whole thing was delicious! The unlimited fries were great too, and I dipped them in Thai Chili, Ranch and Honey Mustard dressings. The seasoned salt on the table is a nice touch. I would recommend that if you do go here for dinner, do not make plans afterward if you have a weak stomach. Although the food quality was good, my stomach couldn't handle the grease, and about an hour later I was feeling sick.

My husband and I went here for Valentine's Day...not so romantic but that's ok. We had intended to be early to a local "steakhouse" but were unsuccessful. So, Red Robin was not our first choice. We were very happy with our meal and service. While the place we wanted to go had a 1 hr wait, we were seated at RR within 10 minutes. Don't get me wrong, they were quite busy and got busier as our meal progressed. We were attended to quickly and had our questions answered in a timely manner. Our drinks came quickly and the "endless bottom" did not disappoint. My hubby got a burger and requested it to be "as pink as they would allow". He was very pleased with it (he can be fussy about his "rare" burgers). I ordered the fish and chips. I also was happy with how it was cooked. I was offered more "bottomless fries" but was too full to take advantage of them. We had two different managers stop by to see how our dining experience was, which was nice. We enjoyed our meal so much that we requested their Red Royalty card. We look forward to going back soon to start racking up perks on our card. One tip...if you want a more private dinner, request to be seated away from the windows that face the mall entrance. We had a few curious onlookers (mostly kids) while we ate.

It was delicious. Staff was very friendly. Service was a little slow but that's to be expected on the first week being open. Alex did a great job especially since it was his first job ever. I'm sure ill be back soon.

I won't take into account that we waited over an hour for a table, because I expected nothing less on a Saturday night around 5:30.  Went here with a fairly large group as they all were interested in trying the place.  If you do come on a Saturday I would suggest going either before 5 or after 7.  Just so you don't have the ridiculous wait. Anyway, the service was really good.  Which I wasn't expecting from a new place with such a new staff.  Never waited long for refills and special requests.  A+ in my book. Onto the food, my girlfriend and I shared the pick two appetizer with fried zucchini and onion rings.  First the zucchini...it is just way too thick to really enjoy.  The zucchini was certainly fresh, but not enjoyable in the form they cook it.  It's almost an inch think and very tasteless.  Avoid this.  The onion rings were standard fare, obviously frozen, not fresh.  If you enjoy this, go ahead and order.  Just don't get your hopes up with super high quality. I ordered a bacon cheese burger with pepper jack, thousand island dressing and crunchy fried onions.  I had ordered this medium, but came out well done.  I'll attribute this to the insane volume of the night.  So, the burger was a tad dry, but not inedible.  Everyone else had burgers as well, and they all really enjoyed them.  1 star was knocked off for the dryness of the burger, and 1 for the disappointing appetizer. We did order the Oreo shake which was incredibly tasty.  Will order that again. They have a full bar and interesting cocktails.  They also have bottomless fries (which I didn't wind up getting more because I was too full) and some bottomless drink options. If you like burgers, it's worth a try.  They do have other options like chicken sandwiches (which they will substitute chicken for any burger choice) and some ribs/chicken finger platters.  I noticed they did have vegan and vegetarian options, which I know people will like.

The service was good but not good - friendly and personable, but they kept getting the orders wrong and taking so long to bring the correct ones out. Manager ended up giving us free desserts. Well priced and really yummy food. I got the garden burger with sweet potato fries and coleslaw. The latter was a very small portion. Had a raspberry tea to drink. I am very picky about teas, and I found theirs to be unsweetened with raspberry flavored shots - was tasty. For dessert, I had the brownie ice cream thing: generic chocolate lava cake with vanilla ice cream, but they also put a strawberry sauce under it which was a nice touch. I really appreciate all the options they offer. Both vegan and vegetarian burgers, plus gluten free buns. So considerate. Overall, great food, reasonably priced, poor efficiency, and friendly staff.

I first tried Red Robin about a year ago in Delaware and instantly became hooked. Unluckily, there were no Red Robins near my home until last month, which meant quick stops when traveling out of state. The Deptford location is in the mall next to Boscovs, which is pretty random, but the set up with glass windows looking into the mall is pretty neat. Despite only being open less than a month, the staff seemed to have everything under control. I went on Thursday night and had to wait about 40 minutes for a table, but it was worth it. I always get the crispy chicken sandwich and it tasted as good as usual. I also tried the pretzel bites and they disappeared quickly! Now, I just have to go back sometime soon and see if their drinks (namely: frozen strawberry margarita and daiquiri) add up to the other locations.

I was here just the other night for dinner while I waited for my son's glasses to be done. The food was basically all burgers. They have a good selection of ways they prepare them and they were tasty. You get unlimited fries w/ your entree which is good for big eaters. I ordered 2 Blue Moon beers at a cost of 4.79 each which is way to high priced. The service is fast and wait staff was polite. I will go back but I won't be ordering any beer if its 4.79 a piece.

The dining area and bathrooms are so filthy I lost my appetite. I watched the staff step on, over or around a half eaten bun in the middle of the isle before someone stopped and picked it up 25 minutes later. The table I was seated at was dirty and my server was unapologetic about it. Service was sluggish. Not the greatest red robin experience.
5 stars for the customer service! I've eaten at many types of restaurants and I never expected customer service to be this good. They really consider you enjoying your meal. Thank you Red Robin!

Finally visited this new location in Deptford. I first discovered Red Robin log before it came to my area and have always been a fan.  This wasn't the best of experiences but it wasn't that bad. My server seemed confused and busy, however we appeared to be one of two tables he had, and it was a slow time. But I keep in mind this is a new location and a new staff, he still did his best to be attentive so I didn't mind. I was given the wrong burger, I ordered a double and got a big tavern burger. I ate it anyways and it was great! Also tried one of their cocktails, for the price and size I thought it was great. My fries were perfect too, I didn't have room to take them up on their bottomless fries and I enjoyed the portion I was given.    My girlfriends wrap was full of sauce, which was displeasing. It pretty much took away from all other ingredients. Also the fruit salad she got in lieu of fries was not fresh. It appeared to be soaked in a sauce or juice and it made for an unappetizing fruit salad.  I love Red Robin, I will return and hopefully some of the kinks are worked out when we do.
Great burgers great drink selection friendly staff a good place to eat in the mall

The kids meals were a good size for my kids. Our waiter Javier did a great job serving us and was good with the kids. He was quick with our food and drinks and made sure we had everything. My barbecue  burger was cooked perfect. The steak fries were awesome. The place was clean for being very busy and service was excellent. It was a half hour wait but they text you when your table is ready while we walked and shopped around the mall.
Excellent onion rings. The burgers are very good. Service is friendly and efficient.  I'll be back

I quite enjoy this place. I use the Red Robin royalty card which seems to make visits to the place seem very affordable. I've had quite a few burgers on their menu. The classic Red's Tavern Double is my favorite because it is a small burger that still has two patties on it (I like a meaty bite!) It's also one of, if not the cheapest burger on the menu. It comes with the unlimited fries still, so you can load up on them if the burger is too small. The appetizers I've had were very good so far, from the pretzel bites with the great mustard, to the mini brat corn dogs, with a different great mustard. I've also had the yukon chips and dip, the chips are great but one time I swear we were given straight up ruffles rather than the yukon chips. Other good burgers I've had include the Oktoberfest burger which had salty ham on it which was really an interesting twist. I've also had the Royal Red Robin which is good, but I don't order it anymore. It comes with a sunny side up egg, but I always ask for it to be hard cooked. I've also had the spicy burger with the fried jalapenos on it, which was a disappointment. The service is half or half... we've had two great waitresses and two not so great. I'm also had my burger come to my table missing almost all of its toppings.  I like that it's in the mall, so you can go shopping before or after. I'm not looking forward to the Cherry Hill store as much since its been relegated to a nearby shopping center instead of the mall itself. The TVs also only show ESPN... boring. The unlimited drinks are nice, especially the specialty ones like a root beer float or the Freckled Lemonade. It is a bit disappointing that you must pay to upgrade your side to other items, but then they are not unlimited. How about cheaper upgrades to one serving and a higher priced unlimited upgrade?

This was my first visit. Very pleased with burger. Meat very tender and juicy like filet. Not a big fries fan so got the chili. It too was great. If you are real hungry get the extra pattie option. The pattie was kind of slim but plenty for my Wife. Will return for sure. Also had lots of chicken entrees and some fish for the non-beef eater. 2 burgers, 2 extra cost sides, 2 drinks = $30 plus tip.

Food is amazing and the employees are very polite and the service is great.  They have a great selection of burgers! I don't eat red meat but they have this Turkey burger that is amazing!!! Definitely recommend this place!
Pretty darn good burger! That's a rare find. I had the Bonsai with endless fries. You have a choice of dips. Yum! The service was great too! I shall return.

I love Red Robin. Traveled the 40 miles or so to The Hamilton store several times. Fortunately, there's this local store and a new Cherry Hill location that just opened. My 2nd visit here was this past Sunday around 4:30. We had a party of 3, and there was no wait for a table. The hostess acted very confused and unnecessarily weaved us around taken tables several times before seating us in a booth. We were quite happy as the Eagles game was still on and they had 15+ TV's all tuned to that channel! Our server was timely in taking our drink orders as we perused the menu. I ordered the Bleu Ribbon Burger (my favorite!). Almost 1/2 hour later, our food arrived. The burgers were very good. However...by the time the food arrived, the Eagles games was over. There was a later game on CBS, but all the TV's remained on the FOX post-game show. We asked our server if we can get the later game turned on. We had to make a 2nd request when our server came to check on us. Then the "manager" came over to ask us what game we wanted (the server actually had to point him to our table!). After 5 minutes of fiddling with a remote, finally "managed" to figure out how to change 1(!) of the TV's to the 2nd game on CBS.  Seriously? They're killing the Sunday football crowd. This store has DirecTV and they probably get ALL the games but the management appears clueless. Service -1 Management -1

Back again at my daughter's request. We had to wait 20+ minutes for the table by the door that was ready when we walked in. It's very drafty. The order was taken. Sodas arrived quickly. It's been 15 minutes and the chocolate milk and shakes have not arrived . . . nor has the food. Soon after the above all arrived.  The Smokehouse burger had a feel of super-prepared from the freezer taste to it.  I am not impressed.  The French fries are the highlight of the meal.  I even had seconds because they are bottomless. This is not my place.  My daughter enjoys it and it is far enough from home that I shouldn't be saddled with coming here too frequently.  That seems to be a good thing.

I love this place! It's probably a good thing they're not super close to me cause I'd be in here all the time.  Many burger choices and they're all great. My favorite part though is campfire sauce to dip bottomless fries or get this BOTTOMLESS BROCCOLI in (yes they have that now and I'm obsessed).  YUM!

Okay. First off. Don't order the root beer float. It's lame at best.and of course, don't ask for water because you won't get it. I don't even see. A manager on the floor to complain too. We don't even have napkins. So come prepared AND BRING YPUR OWN. But on a happier note, the beer is good and cold. And as for the burgers... In the words of Samuel Jackson " that's a tasty burger". So stop in.
Burgers check! Fries check! Onion Ring Tower check!! Great place, love the food!!

Had a great dining experience with my girlfriend for lunch. I ordered the bacon cheeseburger (cooked perfectly) and payed a little extra for sweet potato fries. They were so worth it. Our waitress was very helpful and attentive and did very well. I wish she would have given her name in her intro so that I could give her credit.
Good food, good service. Bottomless steak fries and bottomless rootbeer floats. Chicken Teriyaki sandwich is worth getting, I enjoyed it.

dirty, all the tables were dirty as well as the seats . The staff also seemed sloppy. my waitress was polite and professional. The food greasy not very good. the sweet potato fries were very good. I would never go back
Waited 25 minutes for sauce drenched burger and wrap. So bad we could barely eat it - went in starving and left hungry. Not worth a second chance.
Best burger I think i've ever had. I so wish I got our waitress' name because she was AMAZING. So so so nice and accommodating with every single thing. Really awesome place.

Hot mess, cold food. Was seated fairly quickly on a Thursday afternoon. No server to be found, so the manager took our order with an apology. Overall, there was a feeling of chaos as servers jogged from table to table, bobbing and weaving, avoiding eye contact. The guy seated across from us tried desperately to get someone, anyone, to take his bill as he had been finished eating quite some time ago. 25 minutes later, we commented to each other about how long our food was taking, and wondered if ours was the food that was basking in the warm glow of the heat lamps. Someone overheard us, and promised to bring our food out shortly. When it did arrive, it was cold and not worth the wait. Our server basically did a drive-by serving, and we didn't have a chance to inform her that we had no silverware or napkins. Off she ran, narrowly avoiding the man who was still desperate to pay his bill. My Smoke and Pepper burger was a disappointment. The signature fries tasted as though they were reheated on a hot sidewalk. Everyone working there seemed frustrated. No one came to check on us, and we grabbed the server to tell her our food was cold when we got it. We almost had to set a trap in order to capture her as she darted by. She was nice enough about it, and told us she would take off the chicken sandwich, that was not edible, from our bill... so I'll add a star. Not sure why this place can't seem to get it together. Perhaps the manager should stick to managing rather than taking food orders for his staff. It isn't even as large as most Red Robin restaurants that I've been to. It's as though this one is some sort of simulator for struggling restaurant employees that might be on their way out.

I wish I could give 3 1/2 stars lol but 4 would do. My mom and I came here last month, we were shopping in the area, and we decided to come here, I never was at a Red Robin so we came and I had very high hopes. Our server was very approachable and attentive. The burgers came out quick and warm, a little messy but its a burger! the fries were very warm and crispy and everything fries should be, I would return here if I was in the area.
Went here with my wife and a friend around 8:30pm and there was nobody to assigned seats, a bunch of servers saws us and nobody even approached us waited for a good 5-8 min and left.

It's a burger place, so I wouldn't recommend ordering anything other then burgers. My favorite is the Royal Red Robin- burger with bacon and egg. It's like brinner in a burger- delicious. I tried the bread chicken sandwich with mayo and cheese on a sesame bun. It was actually really delicious. The service here though has always been subpar. I usually get the under enthused waiter who likes to make jokes about how his job sucks, or the unmotivated waitress with black rimmed glasses who is sarcastic and doesn't seem to care.. about anything. I almost want to offer her a hug or something. Tonight two in my party ordered the french onion soup. They said it tasted like water with a bouillon cub in it- and no onions. So I'd probably steer clear of any soups. Milkshakes are okay. Nothing to write home about. Had the mint one before. A friend of mine liked the blue moon shake.
Great veggie burgers! Thanks to Sayda and Maddie she's very nice and seems to be doing well in training tonight Sayda has thought her well.. We will return thanks for the great service..

After waiting 15 min for a server to take our order and servers coming up to say someone will be with you ; then waiting again for our food was very discouraging. We were told 2 servers sent home that day, Wed. I will not be returning. Turkey burger very good; plain cheeseburger too Expensive.

Much rather eat a McDouble than eat here ever again. The burgers NEVER come out correctly cooked and the fries might as well come with extra oil to dip them in. I mean how hard is it for this burger place, that cooks on conveyer belts, to properly cook a burger?  Not to mention that all these "gourmet" burgers are really 73% lean and 27% fat..why pay outrageous prices for a frozen, fatty patty? All they do is add different toppings to make them "gourmet" and "different" so it's not worth the time or the money to eat here. If you want sloppy food with sloppy service backed by sloppy management, then by all means, come here.

Red Robin is an awesome franchise but this location hires the worst host/hostesses on the planet. The servers are decent but wait times on occasion become bothersome. The food is why this review even has stars as it is yummy and affordable. I recommend finding another location if you feel the need to try Red Robin in the future.

First time I ever got into this Red Robin. .. HORRIBLE.  Now mind you I have been too several Red Robins in the past several years and they were wonderful.  This one in Deptford,  nj you should either get new cooks management or close down.  The food was so bad my burger was a black charcoal brick I spit it out in my napkin, they took it off the check but offered no incentive for me or my husband to ever come back and we won't.  Thanks for nothing.  Your restaurant sucks. Theresa and Ron from Erial,  NJ

Meh, I love Red Robin but this location is mediocre. The service is either really good or really bad. They've been opened for over a year or so now and you'd think their staff would be well trained to deal with large crowds, mall rush, or just a simple party of 2. But they really don't. We usually always get the shorti stack of onion rings, so delicious and I love the dipping sauces it comes with. I usually get the crispy chicken salad with poppy honey mustard dressing, chicken bruschetta sandwich, or a simple burger. all of which are very tasty.

The food was good, i had the bacon cheeseburger. And my girlfriend got a veggie burger, which she said was good. The fries were pretty good though some were not as salty. The only negative is theyvwere kind of slow.

As a Royalty Rewards member I had a free birthday burger on my card for the month of July. Decided to use it or lose it. So glad I did. Our server was Erin and she was the best. We've been here a few times and the service has run the whole gamut from not-so-good to stellar. Erin was stellar. My wife went with her usual turkey burger and she was pleased. I had the prime chophouse burger and it was simply amazing. Probably the best burger I ever had from a burger joint. No joke. The only knock I have on this place is that it sees a ton of traffic, being in the mall, and it surely shows. Even after a couple years in business here it seriously needs a makeover. New tables and chairs for sure. Please. Other than that, I love this place.

I was very disappointed with the food on this visit (my third). I had previously ordered the Avacabo salad and LOVED it but they changed their menu and it it smaller and the chicken was bizarre. It had a weird taste and I think had been frozen because the whole outside of the breast peeled off on one layer. Previously it had been fresh and delicious.  I decided to have the truffle stick dessert and it was very cold and one still had a thick piece of ice attached to it.  Bottom line, I'm not going back. Standards have slipped and someone is relying on the freezer and being very lazy with the unfreezing.

Wish I could review the food but left before we had a chance to order or even be greeted by a waiter. Stopped in about 2 weeks ago with my gf and our son. Wanted something in fairly quick but didn't want food court food so stopped into this location. Hostess seated us after taking a little while to find a high chair for my son. Manager came up and asked if we were being helped as the hostesses was looking for the chair which seemed odd that one wasn't around to easily find on a weekday mid afternoon. Finally seated and the wait began.. And continued for a very awkward amount of time. Server after server walked by our table that was in the center literally behind the hostess station. The manager who asked if we were being helped earlier was standing just a few feet away as we watched numerous servers pass us by. After about 15 minutes we decided we had enough and walked out. Past the manager standing right near us who said nothing as we left. The hostess did tell us to have a great day, seemingly forgetting she had seated us about 15 minutes earlier and not noticing nobody acknowledged us after that. A very odd experience to say the least.. Obviously this location needs better training and/or just overall management.

We ate here last week while on vacation. We love red robin as a whole but this specific location our service was not that great!  Our waiter was snappy and it felt like we were a inconveniencing her if we asked for anything. Our drinks were only filled up once and as far as bottomless fries... We never got the extra refill we asked for.  We may have just been in at the wrong time. Love Red Robin as a company and will go back for sure just probably not to this location.

Went to this location for my first Red Robbin visit ever a couple weeks ago with my girlfriend. Food was decent, we got a wrap and a burger and both were pretty good. Beer specials are pretty decent (not sure if it's every RR that has them) and our server was very nice. Only complaint is it took a bit long to get our food, but not crazy crazy long.

Red robin has switched to using Ziosk at the tables. I tried to give the server our order. My daughter already had dinner so she was ordering dessert while I still wanted to order a meal. I was directed to place the drink and dessert order on the Ziosk while she took my meal order. Because of this, my daughter was finished her dessert before my meal even arrived. I mentioned to the server that we had wanted to eat together, to which she replied that my daughter ordered through the Ziosk so it was served first. She did not seem to get that people sitting together might want to eat together.  I told the server that I was not likely to return while they use this system and that I would give that feedback to corporate. She needed to help us when we paid because the paper for the receipt was loaded backwards and the receipt was blank. There was a button on the screen to leave feedback, but she cleared the button for me without my being able to leave the feedback. I won't be returning because the Ziosk feels like I am doing the work of taking my own order and there is no thought put into the timing of serving the food.

This place is unspectacular!  We were a party of 7 and 2 of us ordered salads which included inedible avocados. I informed the server of the issue and literally bounced the too hard to chew food off the table and our server simply said "sorry to hear that". The other salad was described as "something she never saw before in her life".  If you don't mind waiting a ridiculous amount of time for mediocre food with such poor service that you simply have to laugh at them this is your spot. If not I think Burger King is a safer bet.

One star is way too many. I have tried this place many times, but they can't seem to hire good bartenders. The attitude of a couple of the bartenders is beyond belief. Each and every time they act like they are doing me a favor. We went there today...gave it another shot and once again the "super busy" bartender acted put out by our drink order. We intended on having lunch but decided to spend our money elsewhere. This location needs better managers and staff.  I will not be back.  For the love if God- hire people who want to work and are pleasant.

Ok, for this style of semi fast food, chain style restaurant Im pleasantly surprised by Red Robin. This is more of a 3.5 9situation but I'll be kind and round up.  The atmosphere is your typical big booths and generic decor, but it's vert clean. They have an ipad thingie at the table, which I don't care for but that's just me. They have mostly sandwiches and burgers (surprise) with some salads and other things thrown in.  You can substitute a veggie patty, a turkey burger or a chicken patty on any of the pre-designed burgers. The appetizer selection is big.  Childrens menu is broad with some healthy sides to pick from.   The mini wedge salad is a great size. It's small but that's what i like about it. The turkey burgers are big, moist and delicious.  Actually on our second visit my mom and i split one and were still full when leaving.  For those with big appetites, the sides come with free refills.   Both times the service has been good. Our second server was fantastic however. She was funny and just on point - the kind of server you remember and try to ask for again. Complaints: The food can take a while to come out. A single iced tea is something like 2.50 Fries are just meh.   You dont pay the server, but pay on the table iPad thingie...it seems to be inconvenient if you want to pay with cash.

Got seated and took about 10 minutes for Steve to come over. He was very dull. Since we had so much time we put the entire order in all together... he brought the drinks out in a timely fashion. From that point forward, about 20 minutes or so.. all we received was my infant son's avocado so I could feed him. About another 10-15 Ish minutes or so go by and still no order. We address it with Steve who says it'll be right out.. another 5-8 minutes go by, and the gentleman that sat next to us (who came in after us and clearly ordered after us) was already enjoying his lunch. We said screw it and got up. Manager was brought up to us and even tho he did comp us or beverages and avocado - we wouldn't of paid for it anyway - he did also give us 3 cards to act as free entrees for our next visit. My mom and I were actually excited to sit down together for lunch but we had to leave because I need to get the baby home and fed. Scratch McDonald's, I went to taco bell, and she's waiting till she's home.  Glad these cards are the managers business card and don't have an expiration, because it'll be awhile before I'll come back, and I WILL NOT be sitting in Steve's section.

Went to this place on a whim and WOW.... never again.  First off - the floor was covered in a thin layer of grease which made walking an adventure in and of itself. Our food arrived within ten minutes which, at first seemed nice, but after biting into the burger I could taste why. Basically the burger tasted like a glob of mush. The bun wasn't toasted, the meat was gross. I couldn't finish it.  This place also features those new on-the-table computer check-out thingys which allow servers to forget that you exist. Interestingly enough, they're cued to give your server a nice 20% tip for those 4 glorious minutes he/she spent taking and delivering the order.

After complaining about a Red Robin in my hometown, I figured I would give a decent review for this establishment in the chain. I've only eaten here once, thankfully on a weeknight so there were no festering globs of teenagers milling around. This was also my first experience with the tablets Red Robin has started to incorporate into their chain. It was cool, but we didn't use it. Drinks came out quickly, food came out quickly, and a refill of fries came out quickly. I got the smoke and pepper burger, I think that's what it's called, and my boyfriend got some kind of chicken thing. The burger was good but saturated with grease and was falling apart in my hands. Whatever. Sometimes you just want a good ol' unhealthy meal of meat and cheese and carbs. Two burgers and two beers came to, wow, $43. I'm not saying it wasn't worth it but that's pretty dang expensive. ALSO, you pay your bill through the tablet and make sure to read over the % of tip you're giving the server. The computer automatically hikes it up to 18-20%. I'm all for servers making a living wage, but with the computers they don't have to be as attentive to you. Our service was nice, but only came over twice over the course of our meal and that doesn't really warrant almost a $9 tip.  It's a burger joint in a mall and eating there is a hit or miss. Be prepared to dole out the cash though when the bill comes.

.. bottomless fries with every burger is great!! But if your waitress doesnt come back to ask you if you want more fries then its pointless. I ate half my burgwr with the fries it came with then wait abput 10 mins until she brought me more fries... and by that time my burger was cold! Smh.

Not the best, not the worst.  I stopped in for lunch today while shopping at the mall. I didn't want a heavy burger, so I chose a salad -- the crispy chicken something or other (minus the egg because it does not belong in salad). The server was friendly and kept my drink full (and checked on me a few times without really disrupting me). The salad came out in a decent amount of time. It had a nice crunch and great flavors (including the honey mustard poppysead dressing), but the size was disappointing. Meh, it seemed like a snack. I left hungry and it cost me $11 before the tip.  I probably should have gotten a burger.

When we're looking for a bite to eat with our two young kids, Red Robin as an option comes up a lot. For what it is, it's fine. The food, burgers and fries, are good, the service timing is hit or miss (more often a miss), and the wait for a table is moderate. This location has recently undergone a makeover so it's looks a little more contemporary than the previous Ground Round-esque ticky-tacky stuff on the walls theme. I will say that every employee we've had interactions with have been nothing short of polite and eager to please. Last night our appetizer literally came out 90 seconds before our main dish, and this type of pile-up isn't uncommon. I mean, we ordered the appetizer because we were hungry and wanted to nosh before our burgers. If we didn't even have time to eat it before our dinner arrived, what's the point? I feel like this is more a kitchen issue than a server issue, and like I said, we've learned to accept it. So yes, if you're looking for a fine dining experience, keep looking. If you're looking for a casual, kid-friendly restaurant with a wide array of burger choices and you don't mind eating your appetizer along with your main course, Red Robin can fit that bill.
This Red Robin has pretty good food for a chain restaurant. But even with medium to small crowds service is not great.

The experience was pretty good overall. Our table started with an order of their tower onion rings. The onion rings were crunchy and flavorful, and it was especially good because it came with sauce on the side. I ended up having a burger, which was only OK. The bun was stale and actually started to fall apart, and the burger was burnt on the outside. The fries were good and the burger was well cooked on he inside. Our waiter was also very kind. I could see myself coming back again.

I must say not a great srart to this visit at Deptford Red Robin. My frozen Margarita was very tasty but the lipstick on the glass wasn't my shade, it was quickly replaced with a drink that was carelessly made, no salt and not as tasty as the first one. The ladies room was in deplorable condition, the trash cans were overflowing, the floors scattered with paper and trash, there was no paper in the dispenser to dry your hands, totally unacceptable! The food is a better story. Burgers were cooked  to order and delightful as always, as were the bottomless fries. Burgers at Red Robin are thick and juicy with choice that go from very basic to very exotic and everything in between. Red Robin doesn't offer just great burgers, all burgers are available as a chicken sandwich, there's a great selection of salads and platters including very tasty fish and chips.

I remember red robin being really good so I was pretty disappointed with my experience today. We went for lunch and it wasn't crowded, the restaurant was maybe half filled. When we walked in the host was staring at a tablet and didn't acknowledge us for almost a minute, didn't even glance in our direction (which was right in front of him). Once we were seated it took about 10 minutes for a server to take our drink order. We had a toddler with us so I always appreciate quick service, as they can be a ticking time bomb to a toddler meltdown. The apps were good, we split the onion rings and boneless wings. We both got bacon cheese burgers which tasted like a frozen burger you would get at a supermarket, blah. The buns seemed old and were crumbling apart with each bite. I highly doubt I'll be back and if I do it will be just for apps.
The service sucks. From the hostess to the food coming out. Waited half an hour and haven't even gotten appetizers. Won't be back.

This was our fourth time visiting this place in about 3 years.  The first three visits were disasters, mixed up orders, cold food, lack of management and staff that just didn't care.  Today was very different.  We are at the bar and our bartender , who is dressed as a minion attended to everything we needed.  The drinks and food arrived quickly. The food was hot and the burgers perfect.  It became quite busy but she was able to keep up while maintaining a good attitude.  Even though my wife swore she would never come back, this visit changed her mind.  Good job management, we will see you again.

Absolutely terrible service. Waited over 30 minutes for a waiter and no one came. In fact, the surrounding tables were even looking for their waiter. I asked the table next to me and they replied "yeah good luck" we walked out

Showed up just before closing, felt bad, waitress was uber sweet, sat me down, and kept my glass full and I got the best damn burger. Tab was $11 for all you can eat fries and a succulent burger. Going again and again

I have been here on several occasions but they have renovated this location and have updated the menu. I was quite pleased. My husband had the tavern mac burger ( burger with macaroni and cheese on it )  I had the salad with crispy chicken. The food was great. The service was great, she even came over and asked my husband if he wanted more fries ( other times we have dined there, this did not happen ).  My only complaint was the entertainment fee for playing games on their mini computer. I think the prices are high enough to allow the games to be free. It is only $1.99 so it would not break the bank, the restaurant can absorbed the cost and it would be a good selling point!

Ordered burgers and chicken . Food overall good and didn't take to long to be served. Service by waitress average at best . Very nice but forgot condiments and only checked on us once when we were practically done eating .

The burger itself is just okay, but my sesame bun lacked the substance to carry the sandwich. It simply fell apart and wandered all over the plate and me with every bite, and it had this worse than Wonder Bread consistency. I came here on a gift card. Hey it's free, but I would go to Five Guys instead, just down the street from the mall. More burger for your buck without the nonsense of a hostess, seating, anticipation, and Angus let down.

We went for lunch, and were told 15-20 minutes. When that time had come, I decided to walk through the restaurant to see if any more people were waiting at the entrance from within the mall and I saw at least 8 dirty tables never cleaned with no one in sight even attempting to clean them and a manager standing at a waitress stand just smiling and chatting while people were waiting 20 minutes, he couldn't help out ? Terrible management. Waiters and waitresses slouching by looking miserable my guest the management!!!

I am giving this place only 2 stars because they tout the "gourmet" burgers, however on the two occasions I ate a burger here, I was extremely underwhelmed. The burger meat is virtually flavorless as was the bacon on the burger. How the hell can bacon be virtually tasteless? Service was good but I want flavor in my burger, and for that reason I'm out.

You want a good burger you go to Red Robin right? Well not anymore. My meal this afternoon was bad but not as bad as the excuses given by the kitchen manager. There were three of us dining, all burgers, two were burnt to the point where they were hard and blackened, the third was rare still. Fries were all cold. The blazing love burger was a bust, the tomato was mealy, the shredded lettuce they thoughtfully threw on there was limp and old, and they should just give up on the (soggy) fried jalapeños bit. Our waitress was great, and having waited many tables I knew the bad burger wasn't her fault and asked to speak to the kitchen manager simply to inform him of the poor presentation of food, not at a means to get a remake or a discount. A smiley man in a gingham shirt greeted us, attempting to kneel at a raised table he probably needed to tiptoe towards, almost immediately offered us 25% off the bill. We attempted to inform him of where his line cooks may need assistance as this is a burger joint and the burgers aren't even done well. Gingham interrupted to inform us of his short staffing issues, shift changes, and how two people quit/were fired today. He didn't inquire about what burger was disastrous as I tried to explain my attempts at eating my meal, rather he wanted to send us home with more bad food or give us the discount as he clearly valued us as customers. After reviewing that the three of us didn't even eat a whole burger between us we requested to only pay what we actually ate, gingham then comped our meal. Ging did not need to do that rather acknowledging what was actually going wrong in his kitchen would have given us more satisfaction than saving us the few bucks. I have worked at many restaurants, many corporate/chain restaurants, and this was not only distasteful service, but I assume gingham just shoots a smile and a discount at all problems this restaurant has rather than exploring any changes necessary, possibly why he continues to have short staff and retention problems, not to mention the bad food. Red Robin used to be a good place to get burgers, now it's a good place to get a discount I guess.

Went there twice first time service was impeccable second time it was so so,on the second visit my wife and I ordered a salad that came with toast but they were burnt un  edible burnt when I complained to the waitress her answer was your actually lucky the cooks decided to put toast on that salad !!!she didn't get that I didn't care to eat the toast but how could she looking at the extremely burnt toast serve it????guess she forgot she works for tips ????and that answer about the cooks put the toast on the salad when they feel like it???maybe she/they forgot that I was paying for my meal?????????

I was going to give 4 stars but, I found the service here to be notably friendly. My first time at Red Robin.  What a pleasant surprise that fries are always bottomless--hell yeah.  My friend ordered the sweet potato fries, and I the regular steak fries.  Preference went to sweet potato fries, but both are solid and always fresh. I ordered the harissa salmon burger.  Good, but not something I'd order again for the price.  The lemon wheels got lost in the sandwich and the salmon was a little dried out.  I'd be back the next time I'm feelin' like a glutton..

I went here for Mother's Day Weekend and there was no attendant at the hostess' desk, quick was OK because of the time of year. We got a clean table, and I watched other tables get cleaned before they were filled by other patrons. My mom had a so-called "spicy" appetizer, which I tried, and it was mild. I had a Sauteed 'Shroom burger with home fries and an orange cream soda. The burger was great, the fries were good enough and the soda was good as well. We decided to not have dessert. This place earned 4.05 stars.

WORST SERVICE EVER. I gave the Jennifer, the waitress, $1.00 tip which was a 95¢ more than she deserved. I ordered the burger which was fine. I also ordered the onion rings instead of the fries. Fries are bottomless, onion rings are not - even though you pay extra for them (never understood that since onions are MUCH cheaper than potatoes, but all restaurants do it).  My friends ordered more fires and I ordered more onion rings. The waitress Jennifer said that onion rings are not bottomless. She should have told me that when I ordered them, but she didn't. When she was told that another red Robin gives bottomless, she told us not at the Deptford store. She went to put the order ion and asked if I needed more soda (at least that had free refills). I told her yes. A few minutes later the manager came over with the fries refills and explained to me that they do not do bottomless onion rings. He did offer to take the extra $1.49 off my bill. I would have preferred he gave me the free refills on the rings "this time", but he did offer to take the extra off the bill, so he did resolve the issue. BTW - the order of onion rings was 3 small rings and 2 medium rings - hardly worth the extra money. After the manager left, a few more minutes passed and the waitress asked if everything was a ok. I said I am still waiting for my soda refill that I asked for 10 minutes ago. She said okay or something to that effect.Then she goes to pour the soda and winds up taking care of another table. I am a very patient person, but if I already told that I asked for more soda 10 minutes earlier, that should be a rush order, especially when we were only about 20 feet from the soda fountain. In my opinion, she should not have that job. She was the absolute worst waitress I have ever had. I had only 13¢ in coins in my pocket and I felt guilty leaving her just that amount, but if I did leave it, she still would have been over-tipped. Again Jennifer should not have a job in a restaurant. If she wants a job serving food, it should be somewhere like a fast food place where you do not need to wait on tables.

YUMMMM - just like their jingle!  I loved my "schroom" burger!    And the fact that I was able to substitute a Caesar (just okay - a bit watered down) salad for fries was great!  Vince liked his chili burger a lot too!   Maybe his free refills on root beer floats even better?! IDK?!!  Id absolutely go back!

So, my daughter had a few gift cards for stores at the Deptford Mall and this Red Robin is right near her favorite store (Hot Topic), so we stopped in for lunch.  Plus, my son had mentioned eating here and bragging about a burger with macaroni and cheese on it, so of course my daughter wanted to go, lol.  I am not a huge burger person, but they had Nachos on the menu so that's what I ordered.  They were ok. I wasn't crazy about the chili they put on them.  My daughter ordered a mint chocolate chip shake which was really big and she loved it. She also ventured out and ordered a burger that had an egg on it. She loved it. Plus she loved the bottomless fries.  Hubby ordered a whisky burger. He said it was good.  There's really nothing special for me that would make me come here unless we happen to be at the mall but I wouldn't eat in the dining room again.   The bar area is much nicer and the booths in their are more private.

This afternoon my family and I stopped into the Red Robin Gourmet Burgers in Deptford, NJ. We really appreciate the feature of texting when your table is ready. We received our text and 2mins later were seated. The hostess even greeted us by name which became a joke about how she could know it was us. 5mins after that we received another text saying "please come claim your table" while we were already seated. Several mins later the hostess came and questioned us about our reservation. 5 mins later she then came back to the table and essentially berated us for taking another reservation. She said we "were causing havoc" for the staff and the people that should have had our table. She was loud and obnoxious and greatly embarrassed us, even prompting the table next to us to ask what was happening. We spoke to a manager who did apologize for the treatment but was essentially dismissive of the complaint because we were incorrectly logged in the system as a "walk", even though we were seated 2mins after the initial text and hadn't walked. I'm very disappointed in the way we were treated, so much so that I couldn't finish my meal.

I gave this place 5 stars, because the friendly waitress made the whole experience great for us. I got the chicken sandwich, and it was very good. I know the place is known for the burgers, but you cannot go wrong with the chicken. We look forward to our next visit. A special thank you to our waitress Britni, she is another reason we look forward to our next visit. "Red Robin....YUM!!!!!!"

What happen to this place?! It used to be soo good! I WAS a fan of the Burnin Love burger. First my soda came out looking like colored water So gross Returned for a new one. My food came out my burger was smaller than I remembered and it was mooshy... Fries were not cooked and cold. I would of returned my food but waitress was MIA! I'll never go back. So disappointing!

I struggled with whether a review for this place was worth it or not. The only reason it might be is for lack of service. I didn't come here with the intention of getting 5-Star service but I would expect the bare minimum to be there and yet nothing existed. Sad, just sad.  The waiter seemed very nonchalant. He had no sense of time management and missed basic needs and or wants. Unless forced, I'm not coming back. I had no expectations coming here and I'm glad I wasn't disappointed.

I've eaten a Red Robin plenty of times with good experiences.  Not this one.  Stay far away.. it started out bad and got really bad.  We were seated for a party of 7 after about 20 minutes.  4 kids and three adults.  The floors were filthy with food still all under the tables and chairs.  So disgusting that no one bothered sweeping a little.  The tables next to us remained uncleaned from the prior patrons for well over half an hour.  The place was super busy so I get it. The waiter was a really nice guy and I realize not everything was his fault.  But the manager of this place.. I'd seriously question his/her abilities to manage at all. Our order was taken and we were told that there was no silverware or plates.  Okay... yet with no silverware or plates they still brought  the appetizers.  We put the food on our napkins of which the waiter commended us for thinking outside the box.  Hmmm... Some of our drinks came - some didn't.  We asked several times. Then the plates came but no silverware - and no additional napkins to replace the ones we used to put our appetizers on.  Then the entrees came.  Awesome.  We waited, and waited.. and waited... finally my wife got up and asked for the silverware so we could eat but by then the food was cold and the kids were pretty grumpy.  The other drinks came some time later when the meal was almost over including a shake that was supposed to come before the meal was served. So - this was the good part.  At about 10:00 p.m. my daughter threw up.  Then at about 2:00 a.m. my wife and youngest son started throwing up and haven't stopped since (it's now 10:00 a.m.).  The three of them had shared a small pepperoni pizza.  The other 4 of us didn't have any of the pizza and are all fine.  So.. you tell me?  I wonder how many people that ate at Red Robin and had the pizza got sick.... bad service, dirty restaurant.. eat salads with your hands.. (why serve the food if there are no utensils?)  Couldn't they have brought the "to go" utensils?  In my opinion just poorly managed then to top it off with 3 of us getting really sick.

We've been wanting to try this place since they opened about five years ago, but hadn't gotten there-until Thursday. My husband and I sat at the bar and the bartenders were friendly and helpful. I was torn between two items and the bartender gave me the exact advice and logical thinking I was looking for. When our burgers came, we were hoping to be pleasantly surprised. Instead, we were blown away at just how good the angus burgers were! Juicy and delicious and cooked exactly as ordered! We will certainly be back!!!
